intro: Sedum alaskanum, commonly known as Alaska sedum, is a succulent plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It thrives in harsh, cold environments and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers in the summer months. It is often found growing on rocky slopes and in tundra habitats. Sedum alaskanum is a hardy species that plays an important role in stabilizing soil in its native ecosystems.
